text: The President of Ethiopia, officially the President of the Federal Republic of Ethiopia is the head of state of Ethiopia. The position is largely a ceremonial one. The executive power is exercised by the Prime Minister of Ethiopia. The current president is Taye Atske Selassie, who took office on 7 October 2024. Presidents are elected by the House of Peoples' Representatives for six years, with a two-term limit. ==List of presidents== Portrait Name Term of office Term of office Term of office Party Elected Portrait Name Took office Left office Time in office Party Elected • Chairman of Provisional Military Government of Socialist Ethiopia (Derg) (1974–1987) • 1 Lieutenant general Aman Mikael Andom 15 September 1974 17 November 1974 – Major Mengistu Haile Mariam 17 November 1974 28 November 1974 — 2 Brigadier general Tafari Benti 28 November 1974 3 February 1977† — 3 Lieutenant colonel Mengistu Haile Mariam 3 February 1977 10 September 1987 — • President of People's Democratic Republic of Ethiopia (1987–1991) • 1 Mengistu Haile Mariam 10 September 1987 21 May 1991 WPE 1987 – Tesfaye Gebre Kidan 21 May 1991 27 May 1991 WPE — • President of Transitional Government of Ethiopia (1991–1995) • – Meles Zenawi 28 May 1991 22 August 1995 TPLF — • President of Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia (1995–present) • 1 Negasso Gidada 22 August 1995 8 October 2001 ODP Independent 1995 2 Girma Wolde-Giorgis 8 October 2001 7 October 2013 Independent 2001 2007 3 Mulatu Teshome 7 October 2013 25 October 2018 ODP 2013 4 Sahle-Work Zewde 25 October 2018 7 October 2024 Independent 2018 5 Taye Atske Selassie 7 October 2024 Incumbent Independent 2024 ==References== ==Other websites== * World Statesmen - Ethiopia
title: President of Ethiopia
